ygData.subject: Re: Malachite in Qeynos? NO MORE?!?!
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree 100%.  If you have ever been out of  the US you will notice how much more in general most consumer goods are.  It is the variety of economy that makes
ygData.messageBody:
I agree 100%. If you have ever been out of the US you will notice how
much more in general most consumer goods are. It is the variety of
economy that makes EQ interesting. In fact they even note in the
instructions that certain vendors will pay more for you goods then
others (town vendors versus vendors out in the wilderness). What I
think would be of more benefit would be the ability to make money from
buying goods say in Freeport, and then bringing them to Felwithe to
sell for a profit. While I can appreciate Verant's attempt to create a
totally player driven economy; one should be able to make a minimal
living dealing with NPC's to some extent (with the exception of
fishing).

In particular the creation of magic jewelry kills me. I create
something for 5.5PP, sell it to a vendor for 4.5PP, he in turn marks it
up to 98PP. You should at least be able to recover your initial
investment on these trade skills (not to mention the fact all the money
lost on failures).

Merauk
Cazic-Thule
Enchanter

-----Original Message-----
From: bbutler
Sent: Monday, May 10, 1999 10:25 AM
To: .EQ.Magic
Cc: bbutler
Subject: Re: [_EQ_Magic] Malachite in Qeynos? NO MORE?!?!

From: "Bill Butler" <bbutler@...>

Im sorry but this whole thread is silly. So what if the prices are
different.. That is part of the game. I get my spells a bunch cheaper
in Felwithe than other places. As in RL life, it expensive to travel
from home atleast you dont have to pay for a hotel evernight. But i
find the loot and experience is worth the trip. IF you think it is bad
being what everrace you are.. Try a Dark Elf.. Most will merchants
will Kill you on sight, if they dont they mostlikely wont sell to you.
Try having to rely on friends to sell for you evernight or traveling
back to the commons or neriak..




From: Vincent Archer <Vincent.Archer@...>

According to myself:
> Merchants are racists. Even in your guildhouse do they rip you. Over
the
> 8th level spells, I spare almost a platinum by going back to Felwithe
> over the Freeport prices.

I just made the trip yesterday, after writing down the exact prices
(down
to copper). There's a difference of 2 gold, 8 silver and 1 copper
between
the Freeport prices and the Felwithe prices, adding to over a 1
platinum
when I purchased all the 8 levels spells I wanted (Shock of Frost,
Shadow
Step, Shielding, Eye of Zoom).

It made a large difference. I was unable to purchase all spells if I
remained in Freeport, but making the trip was worth it.

The difference in percentage remains at level 12; there's a 4 gold
difference in prices. I'll see if I still feel the need to spare 2pp
over
the 12th level spells.

--
